purpose.summary: This file is the source code for the IMS Database Definition (DBD) named PADFLDBD, generated via DBDGEN. It specifies GSAM and BSAM access methods for a simple database with no segments. A single dataset group DSG001 is defined, including input dataset PADFILIP (DD1) and output dataset PADFILOP (DD2), both using fixed-length records of 200 bytes (RECFM=F).

inputs.name: PADFILIP
inputs.description: Input dataset defined as DD1 in dataset group DSG001 for the PADFLDBD database

outputs.name: PADFILOP
outputs.description: Output dataset defined as DD2 in dataset group DSG001 for the PADFLDBD database

business_rules.description: Access to the PADFLDBD IMS database is restricted to GSAM and BSAM methods only
business_rules.logic_summary: Explicitly defined in the DBD macro with ACCESS=(GSAM,BSAM)

business_rules.description: Datasets in DSG001 must use fixed-length records (RECFM=F) of exactly 200 bytes
business_rules.logic_summary: Specified in the DSG macro with RECORD=(200),RECFM=F

open_questions.question: No IMS segments or fields are defined in this DBD
open_questions.context: The DBD defines only datasets and access methods without any SEGMENT, FIELD, or DATASET macros beyond DSG001
open_questions.suggestion: Review application programs or additional DBD sources for segment definitions if this is a root-only or GSAM-specific database
